cyclone.name: FRED
cyclone.current_location: about 15 miles SSW of Caibarién, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Turning WNW tonight, then NW through the eastern Gulf of Mexico; forecast to track just west of the Lower Florida Keys Saturday, parallel the west coast of Florida, and make landfall along the Florida Panhandle before moving inland toward the Tennessee Valley and lower Ohio Valley by mid-week.

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch from Englewood FL southward and eastward to Ocean Reef, including portions of the southwest Florida coast.
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning for the Florida Keys west of Ocean Reef to Dry Tortugas and Florida Bay.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Keys, western Florida peninsula, and Florida Panhandle; inland impacts expected across the Southeast U.S.
weather_observation.wind: Low risk of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; probabilities remain below 10%, with any gusts generally under gale force.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None – Cleveland is an inland freshwater port on Lake Erie and not subject to ocean storm surge from Fred.
weather_observation.rainfall: Remnant moisture could bring periods of rain and embedded thunderstorms Tuesday–Wednesday, but current guidance keeps totals generally below 2 inches.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated thunderstorms with brief gusty winds; minor river or urban flooding possible if heavier rain bands reach northern Ohio.
